data.description: Industry/SectorNot ApplicableSpecialismInternational Tax ServicesManagement LevelSenior AssociateJob Description & SummaryAt PwC, our people in tax services focus on providing advice and guidance to clients on tax planning, compliance, and strategy. These individuals help businesses navigate complex tax regulations and optimise their tax positions.Those in international tax at PwC will provide advice and guidance to clients on structuring their global tax positions. Your work will involve analysing international tax laws and regulations to develop strategies that optimise tax efficiency and minimise risks for multinational businesses.Driven by curiosity, you are a reliable, contributing member of a team. In our fast-paced environment, you are expected to adapt to working with a variety of clients and team members, each presenting varying challenges and scope. Every experience is an opportunity to learn and grow. You are expected to take ownership and consistently deliver quality work that drives value for our clients and success as a team. As you navigate through the Firm, you build a brand for yourself, opening doors to more opportunities.Examples of the skills, knowledge, and experiences you need to lead and deliver value at this level include but are not limited to:Apply a learning mindset and take ownership for your own development.Appreciate diverse perspectives, needs, and feelings of others.Adopt habits to sustain high performance and develop your potential.Actively listen, ask questions to check understanding, and clearly express ideas.Seek, reflect, act on, and give feedback.Gather information from a range of sources to analyse facts and discern patterns.Commit to understanding how the business works and building commercial awareness.Learn and apply professional and technical standards (e.g. refer to specific PwC tax and audit guidance), uphold the Firm's code of conduct and independence requirements.The OpportunityAs a National Tax Services - International Tax LLM Senior Associate, you will engage in complex international tax matters, providing strategic guidance and solutions to clients navigating the intricacies of global tax regulations. As a Senior Associate, you will leverage your analytical skills to manage workstreams, develop deliverables, and build meaningful client relationships. You will mentor junior team members, fostering their growth while maintaining professional and technical standards. This role offers the chance to deepen your understanding of international tax laws, including foreign tax credits and tax treaties, while contributing to the firm's business strategies. You will be part of the National Tax Services team, where your insights will drive impactful tax planning and compliance solutions. Embrace the opportunity to navigate complex tax scenarios, anticipate client needs, and grow your personal brand in a dynamic environment. This position is ideal for professionals eager to expand their technical knowledge and influence in the field of international taxation, while developing a deeper understanding of the business context and its evolving landscape.Responsibilities- Analyzing complex international tax issues and developing strategic solutions for clients- Conducting tax research to provide accurate and up-to-date information on international tax regulations- Preparing tax documents and reports to support compliance with international tax laws- Advising clients on tax planning strategies to optimize their global tax positions- Collaborating with stakeholders to manage tax risk and ensure regulatory compliance- Utilizing knowledge of Controlled Foreign Companies and Base Erosion and Profit Shifting to address cross-border tax challenges- Engaging in financial accounting and reporting to align with International Financial Reporting Standards- Supporting domestic restructuring efforts to enhance tax efficiency and compliance- Implementing tax governance frameworks to maintain adherence to tax legislation- Participating in integrated global structuring to achieve tax-efficient international operations- Facilitating stakeholder engagement to drive successful tax consulting projects- Developing corporate tax planning strategies to maximize investment returns- Managing structured transactions to meet specific financial objectives- Providing guidance on foreign tax credit applications to mitigate double taxation- Leveraging financial risk management skills to protect economic value in tax-related decisionsWhat You Must Have- Currently pursuing or have completed a Masters of Laws degree- Before starting full-time at PwC, meet the educational requirements and demonstrate a commitment to undertaking and passing Bar exam- At least a 3.0 overall GPAWhat Sets You Apart- Preference for a 3.3 overall GPA- Demonstrating analytical thinking in complex tax scenarios- Utilizing financial risk management strategies effectively- Engaging stakeholders in international tax planning- Navigating regulatory compliance consulting with precision- Preparing tax documents with attention to detailTravel RequirementsUp to 20%Job Posting End DateLearn more about how we work: https://pwc.to/how-we-workPwC does not intend to hire experienced or entry level job seekers who will need, now or in the future, PwC sponsorship through the H-1B lottery, except as set forth within the following policy: https://pwc.to/H-1B-Lottery-Policy.As PwC is an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at PwC without regard to race; color; religion; national origin; sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity); age; disability; genetic information (including family medical history); veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or, any other status protected by law. For only those qualified applicants that are impacted by the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, the Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, San Diego County Fair Chance Ordinance, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable, arrest or conviction records will be considered for Employment in accordance with these laws.  At PwC, we recognize that conviction records may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship to responsibilities such as accessing sensitive company or customer information, handling proprietary assets, or collaborating closely with team members. We evaluate these factors thoughtfully to establish a secure and trusted workplace for all.The salary range for this position is: $77,000 - $214,000. Actual compensation within the range will be dependent upon the individual's skills, experience, qualifications and location, and applicable employment laws. All hired individuals are eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. PwC offers a wide range of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401k, holiday pay, vacation, personal and family sick leave, and more. To view our benefits at a glance, please visit the following link: https://pwc.to/benefits-at-a-glance
